events.message: Customer reported a car accident involving a collision with another vehicle at an intersection around 7 AM.
The claim was categorized under Auto Accident after reviewing the initial report and keywords such as car and collision.
An insurance agent specializing in vehicle accidents was assigned to handle the claim and communicate with the customer.
The customer received formal acknowledgment of the claim submission along with the process outline and support contact details.
Customer was asked to submit photos of the damaged vehicle and a police report relating to the accident for investigation purposes.
Customer provided the requested photographs and official police documentation verifying the collision details and damage extent.
An accident investigator was assigned to review all documents and assess the damage severity and liability based on submitted evidence.
Investigation concluded with confirmation of fault and damage estimate to the vehicle, pending approval for claim settlement.
A settlement proposal was sent to the customer outlining the reimbursement amount for repairs and any applicable coverage conditions.
Customer responded positively to the proposed settlement and expressed gratitude for the timely updates and clear communication.
The claim approval was officially granted based on investigation and customer acceptance of the proposed terms and settlement amount.
Reimbursement payment was issued to the customerâ€™s account for vehicle repair costs in line with the approved settlement agreement.
Following successful payment and customer confirmation, the insurance claim for the auto accident was formally closed in the system.
All relevant documents and communication related to the auto accident claim were archived for future reference and compliance.
